text.section:
The owner or operator of a high voltage line shall perform any act that is reasonably necessary to carry out the safety measures required by § 6-107 of this title to guard effectively against accidental contact with the high voltage line:
after notification from a person who intends to perform an activity listed under § 6-106 of this subtitle within 10 feet of a high voltage line;
after the person who intends to perform the activity has made any appropriate arrangements; and
within a reasonable time.

This section does not require an owner or operator of a high voltage line to:
bear the expense of any safety measure required by this title; or
de-energize or ground any high voltage line if doing so would:
substantially interfere with service to the public; or
endanger the health, safety, or welfare of the public.
